sen.j: 韓天寿（かん てんじゅ、男性、享保12年（1727年） - 寛政7年3月23日 (旧暦)（1795年5月11日））は、江戸時代中期の日本の書家である。
sen.e: Tenju KAN (male, 1827-May 11, 1795) was a Japanese calligrapher in the middle of the Edo period.
Tenju KAN (male, 1727-May 11, 1795) was a Japanese calligrapher in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 1827→誤訳のため1727に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tenju KAN (male, 1727 - May 11, 1795) was a Japanese calligrapher in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: また画・篆刻も巧みであった。
sen.e: He was also good at painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving).
He was also good at painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving).
He was also good at painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving).

sen.j: 本姓は青木氏。
sen.e: His main name was Aoki.
His main name was Aoki.
His main name was Aoki.

sen.j: 名の天寿は、本来「たかかず」と読む。
sen.e: His name 天寿 (Tenju) was originally pronounced 'Takakazu.'
His name 天寿 (Tenju) was originally pronounced 'Takakazu.'
His name 天寿 (Tenju) was originally pronounced 'Takakazu.'

sen.j: 字は大年、号 (称号)は酔晋斎、三岳道者。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was 大年, his second name or alias was 酔晋斎 and Sangaku-doja.
His azana (adult male's nickname) was 大年, his second names or aliases were Suishinsai and Sangaku-doja.
sen.cmt: 酔晋斎→Suishinsaiに訂正しました。http://matsusaka-kanko.com/kan/senken/shokai.html参照しました。his second name or alias was→複数形に訂正しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was 大年, his second names or aliases were Suishinsai and Sangaku-doja.

sen.j: 百済の余璋王の後裔であることから韓を名乗り韓天寿と称する。
sen.e: Since he was a descendant of Yosho O (Prince Yosho) of Baekje, he used the family name KAN and referred himself as Tenju KAN.
Since he was a descendant of Yosho O (Prince Yosho) of Baekje, he used the family name KAN and referred to himself as Tenju KAN.
sen.cmt: referred himself→referred to himselfに訂正しました。（文法上）asの後のスペースを詰めました。
sen.e: Since he was a descendant of Yosho O (Prince Yosho) of Baekje, he used the family name KAN and referred to himself as Tenju KAN.

sen.j: 通称中川長四郎。
sen.e: His common name was Choshiro Nakagawa.
His common name was Choshiro Nakagawa.
His common name was Choshiro Nakagawa.

sen.j: 伊勢国の人。
sen.e: He was from Ise Province.
He was from Ise Province.
He was from Ise Province.

sen.j: 京都の青木家に生まれたが、伊勢の両替商中川家の養子となった。
sen.e: He was born in the Aoki family in Kyoto, but was adopted by the Nakagawa family, who owned money-exchange business in Ise Province.
He was born in the Aoki family in Kyoto, but was adopted by the Nakagawa family, who owned money-exchange business in Ise Province.
He was born in the Aoki family in Kyoto, but was adopted by the Nakagawa family, who owned money-exchange business in Ise Province.

sen.j: 33歳で家業を継ぐ。
sen.e: He succeeded the family business at the age of 33.
He succeeded the family business at the age of 33.
He succeeded the family business at the age of 33.

sen.j: 屋号は田丸屋といった。
sen.e: The yago (the name of the store) was Tamaruya.
The yago (the name of the store) was Tamaruya.
The yago (the name of the store) was Tamaruya.

sen.j: 書ははじめ松下烏石に就いて文徴明の書法を学んだ。
sen.e: He first learned shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of Chomei BUN under Useki MATSUSHITA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He first learned shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of Chomei BUN under Useki MATSUSHITA.
He first learned shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of Chomei BUN under Useki MATSUSHITA.

sen.j: 40歳頃に二王（王羲之・王献之）に師法し書の研究に没頭した。
sen.e: Around the age of 40, he studied under Nio (Xizhi WANG and Wang Xianzhi) and committed himself to studying calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around the age of 40, he studied under Nio (Xizhi WANG and Xianzhi WANG) and committed himself to studying calligraphy.
sen.cmt: Wang Xianzhi→Xianzhi WANGに訂正しました。
sen.e: Around the age of 40, he studied under Nio (Xizhi WANG and Xianzhi WANG) and committed himself to studying calligraphy.

sen.j: 当時書名は高かった。
sen.e: At that time, 書名 was high.
sen.cmt: 「書名」の意味がわかりませんでした。金額のことを言っているのであればhighでなくexpensiveのほうがいいと思います。
sen.e: At that time, 書名 was high.
At that time, the title of the book was well-known.

sen.j: 法帖の制作者としても知られ曹全碑や皇甫府君などの法帖を精巧に模刻している。
sen.e: Tenju is also known as a creator of copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy such as 曹全碑 and 皇甫府君, which was made by Tenju by carefully imitating the calligraphy.
Tenju is also known as a creator of copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy such as Sozenhi and Kohofukun, which was made by Tenju by carefully imitating the calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 曹全碑→Sozenhiに訂正しました。http://www.japanfunabashi.com/takuhon_hist/01souzen参照しました。皇甫府君→Kohofukunに訂正しました。http://porta.ndl.go.jp/Result/R000000008/I000019351参照しました。
sen.e: Tenju is also known as a creator of copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy such as Sozenhi and Kohofukun, which was made by Tenju by carefully imitating the calligraphy.

sen.j: 山水画の臨模も盛んに行い、伊孚九と池大雅の山水画を縮小して模刻した『伊孚九・池大雅山水画譜』を刊行している。
sen.e: He also imitated sansui-ga, and published "伊孚九・池大雅山水画譜" in which he decreased the size and imitated the sansui-ga drawn by Fukyu I and IKE no Taiga.

He also imitated sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting), and published "I Fukyu IKE no Taiga Sansui-ga Fu" in which he reduced the size and imitated the sansui-ga drawn by Fukyu I and IKE no Taiga.
sen.cmt: sansui-ga→()内の説明を補足しました。伊孚九・池大雅山水画譜→"I Fukyu IKE no Taiga Sansui-ga Fuに訂正しました。http://terpconnect.umd.edu/~tilakh/reiko/Ehon1b.html参照しました。decreased→原文の意味に近いreducedに訂正しました。
sen.e: He also imitated sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting), and published "I Fukyu IKE no Taiga Sansui-ga Fu" in which he reduced the size and imitated the sansui-ga drawn by Fukyu I and IKE no Taiga.

sen.j: 画は文人画風の山水図を画き、篆刻も巧みだった。
sen.e: He painted literati painting style sansui-zu, and was also good at tenkoku.
He painted literati painting style sansui-zu (a painting of the landscape), and was also good at tenkoku.
sen.cmt: sansui-zu→()内の説明を補足しました。
sen.e: He painted literati painting style sansui-zu (a painting of the landscape), and was also good at tenkoku.

sen.j: 先端が鍵型になった双鈎という印刀を使うことができたという。
sen.e: It is said that he was able to use soko, a knife used to carve seals whose point is shaped like a hook.
It is said that he was able to use soko, a knife used to carve seals whose point is shaped like a hook.
It is said that he was able to use soko, a knife used to carve seals whose point is shaped like a hook.

sen.j: 池大雅と高芙蓉と親しく交わった。
sen.e: He was close with IKE no Taiga and Fuyo KO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was close with IKE no Taiga and Fuyo KO.
He was close with IKE no Taiga and Fuyo KO.

sen.j: 三人で富士山・白山・立山に登山したことから、三人ともが三岳道者と号している。
sen.e: Since three of them climbed Mt.Fuji, Mt. Haku and Mt. Tate together, they call themselves as Sangaku-doja.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since three of them climbed Mt. Fuji, Mt. Haku and Mt. Tate together, they call themselves as Sangaku-doja.
sen.cmt: asの後のスペースを詰めました。Mt.Fuji→Mt. Fujiに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since three of them climbed Mt. Fuji, Mt. Haku and Mt. Tate together, they call themselves as Sangaku-doja.

sen.j: なお、青木夙夜は従弟にあたり天寿を通じて大雅の門弟となっている。
sen.e: Also, Shukuya AOKI is Tenju's cousin who became a disciple of IKE no Taiga through Tenju.
Also, Shukuya AOKI was Tenju's cousin who became a disciple of IKE no Taiga through Tenju.
sen.cmt: is→wasに時制を訂正しました。
sen.e: Also, Shukuya AOKI was Tenju's cousin who became a disciple of IKE no Taiga through Tenju.

sen.j: 中川家には蔵書が多かったが、その上に更に古い法帖や墨籍の蒐集を続けた。
sen.e: The Nakagawa family had a lot of book collections and further continued to collect old copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy and 墨籍.
sen.cmt: 「墨籍」は読み方・意味ともにわかりませんでした。
sen.e: The Nakagawa family had a lot of book collections and he further continued to collect old copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy and 墨籍.
sen.cmt: further continued→主語があいまいであるため、he（天寿を指す）を補足しました。墨籍→墨蹟（墨跡）の誤字であると思われますが、確証取れないため修正を加えませんでした。
sen.e: The Nakagawa family had a lot of book collections and he further continued to collect old copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy and 墨籍.

sen.j: しかし、国内の法帖は劣悪でみるに堪えなかったので高価な金額でも中国から舶載されたものを購入した。
sen.e: However, copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy in Japan were poor quality and not good enough to look at, so he purchased those shipped from China even regardless of the high price.

However, copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy in Japan were poor quality and not good enough to look at, so he purchased those shipped from China regardless of the high price.

However, copybooks printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy in Japan were poor quality and not good enough to look at, so he purchased those shipped from China regardless of the high price.

sen.j: 隣家の火災が延焼したときも何よりもまずその蔵書を守った。
sen.e: When the next door neighbor had a fire, the first thing he protected was his collection of books.
When the next door neighbor had a fire, the first thing he protected was his collection of books.
When the next door neighbor had a fire, the first thing he protected was his collection of books.

sen.j: 収集癖が高じすぎて晩年は貧窮した。
sen.e: Due to his habit of collecting books, he struggled financially in his later years.
Due to his habit of collecting books, he struggled financially in his later years.
Due to his habit of collecting books, he struggled financially in his later years.

sen.j: 伊勢松坂市清光寺に葬られる。
sen.e: Buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Matsuzaka-City, Ise Province.
Buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Matsusaka City, Ise Province.
sen.cmt: Matsuzaka-City→Matsusaka Cityに訂正しました。http://www.post.japanpost.jp/cgi-zip/zipcode.php?pref=24&city=1242040&cmp=1参照しました。
sen.e: Buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Matsusaka City, Ise Province.

sen.j: また京都東山 (京都府)通妙寺にも墓所がある。
sen.e: His grave is also located in Tsumyo-ji Temple in Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture).
His grave is also located in Tsumyo-ji Temple in Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture).
His grave is also located in Tsumyo-ji Temple in Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 享年69。
sen.e: Died at the age of 69.
Died at the age of 69.
Died at the age of 69.
